Homoglyphs and Confusables Test File

This file contains various confusable characters from different scripts to test UTS #39 detection.

Example 1: Cyrillic confusables (lowercase)
Ñ€Ğ°Ñƒ thĞµ bÑ–ll (contains Cyrillic 'Ñ€', 'Ñƒ', 'Ñ–' instead of Latin)

Example 2: Cyrillic confusables (uppercase)
ĞœĞ†CROĞ…OFT (contains Cyrillic 'Ğœ', 'Ğ†', 'Ğ…' instead of Latin)

Example 3: Greek confusables (lowercase)
gÎ¿Î¿gle pĞ°ypal (contains Greek 'Î¿', 'Î±' instead of Latin)

Example 4: Greek confusables (uppercase)
Î’Î•Î¤Î‘ Î¤Î•Ğ…Î¤ (contains Greek 'Î’', 'Î•', 'Î¤', 'Î‘' instead of Latin)

Example 5: Mathematical alphanumeric symbols
ğ“ğ¡ğ¢ğ¬ ğ¢ğ¬ ğ›ğ¨ğ¥ğ ğ­ğğ±ğ­ (math bold)
ğ‘‡â„ğ‘–ğ‘  ğ‘–ğ‘  ğ‘–ğ‘¡ğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘–ğ‘ ğ‘¡ğ‘’ğ‘¥ğ‘¡ (math italic)

Example 6: Fullwidth Latin characters
ï¼´ï¼¨ï¼©
